Caesar.Action: Protects infant chimpanzee, displaying concern for its wellbeing and safety.
Not present or active in this excerpt, no direct behavior to assess competence.
Looks down at the infant peacefully cradled in his arms.
Navigates the house skillfully, climbs a ladder hidden by a fold-down mechanism, and observes the outside world carefully from a vantage point.
Demonstrates cautious curiosity by quietly watching neighborhood events, showing awareness and intelligence.
Slides the ketchup to Will when asked.
Uses American Sign Language to sincerely say 'You're welcome.'
Successfully completes a puzzle intended for ages 12 and up, demonstrates use of American Sign Language to communicate politely.
Effortlessly eats breakfast using utensils, interacts appropriately with humans (sliding ketchup over), showing understanding of social cues.
Expresses hunger simply and clearly by saying 'Ice cream' and 'Soft-serve' in a friendly, straightforward way.
Responds to Will's embarrassment and concern by coming over to him, showing empathy and care.
Communicates needs clearly using simple words like 'Ice cream' and 'Soft-serve', indicating an understanding of language and effective communication.
Tries to climb off the examining table despite Will's warning to stay put, showing a degree of initiative but possibly a lack of control or disregard for instructions.
Engages cooperatively in a challenging puzzle task with Will, showing patience and focus.
Methodically solves the block puzzle by moving blocks one at a time without violating the rules, quickly and accurately, completing the task in the minimum number of moves.
Pauses and backtracks to correct moves instead of giving up or making careless errors.
Shows understanding and effectively applies a complex rule-based task representing advanced cognitive skills.
Solves a puzzle at age two, demonstrating advanced aptitude and signing over three hundred words.
Shows curiosity and eagerness as he pumps his legs higher on the swing to get a better look at what is happening in the neighbor's yard.
Tosses the ball to Todd's Buddy to initiate play, shows eagerness for social interaction.
Undoes the clamps on his swing harness independently and escapes confinement.
Attempts social engagement by picking up a ball and playing catch with the kids, showing social awareness and initiative.
Stands unsure after escaping, indicating hesitation about next steps.
Laughs along with others, showing a friendly and social attitude.
Responds with hot rage and confronts Todd after realizing he is being mocked.
Cowers and seeks comfort in Will's arms when threatened, showing vulnerability and trust.
Climbs into Will's arms, burying his head in his neck, showing trust and affection.
Looks out the window excitedly on the way to the forest, showing curiosity and positive engagement.
Runs freely and plays happily in the forest when released from his harness, showing trust and joy in the company of humans.
Ignores Will's instruction to stay visible and close, becoming captivated by the forest, suggesting some disregard for caution or Will's concern.
Climbs and moves through the forest and trees with ease and grace, showing physical agility and comfort in his environment.
Becomes captivated and somewhat inattentive to Will's instruction to stay visible and not go far, showing potential lack of situational awareness or heedlessness.
Demonstrates growth and maturity over three years, with confident exploration of surroundings and observing distant landmarks, implying intelligence and situational awareness.
Turns and gives a large chimpanzee snarl, baring his teeth at the barking dog.
Watches the woman walk off with the dog, gaze lingering on the leash, then on his own leash, reflecting on his status.
Turns and gives a large chimpanzee snarl, baring his teeth to intimidate a threatening dog, successfully frightening it away.
Watches the woman walk away with the dog, gazing at the leash and then his own, showing introspection and awareness of his situation.
Follows Will without apparent confusion despite disorientation from the environment changes (zoo renovations and wrong turns).
Watches neighborhood teenagers with fascination and desire to be part of their world.
Stands silently and transfixed while a grizzled chimp looks deeply into his soul, showing receptiveness and respect.
Stares intently and is transfixed by a grizzled old male chimp who looks into his soul, showing deep awareness and recognition of significance.
Watches neighborhood teenagers and tries to understand human social behaviors, showing curiosity and learning ability.
Stands in front of a mirror trying to imitate human posture and gait, indicating self-awareness and deliberate effort to learn new skills.
With care and compassion, helps the old man by adjusting the spoon.
Reaches over and helps the old man with care and compassion, adjusting the spoon.
Strains for a last glimpse outside the car window, showing attachment and longing.
Sits on the floor drawing a self-portrait, indicating introspection but no direct social warmth shown here.
Body slams Hunsiker after seeing him threaten Walter, defending a vulnerable person.
Bites off Hunsiker's finger in rage, showing violent aggression beyond self-defense.
Immediately reacts to the sound of a crash, assesses the situation quickly by observing Hunsiker and Walter before taking action.
Body slams Hunsiker and aggressively defends Walter by violently attacking Hunsiker, including biting off his finger; demonstrates physical capability and decisiveness.
Ignores Walter's attempts to stop him, showing a lack of self-control and impulsiveness which may undermine effective problem solving.
Pursues Hunsiker aggressively, blocking his path, kicking him in the chest, and standing over him while he cowers.
Effectively blocks Hunsiker's entrance to the house, anticipating his moves.
Disappears from view to confuse and trap Hunsiker, showing strategic thinking.
Swings from tree to tree to pursue Hunsiker, demonstrating agility and skill in movement.
Calmly kicks Hunsiker and stands over him confidently, showing control and assertiveness.
Looks down at Hunsiker, cringing after realizing the consequences of his actions.
Shows excitement and curiosity about visiting the ranch and seeing other animals.
Senses Will's sadness and asks about it, showing concern for his owner.
Realizes the consequences of his actions immediately after confronting Hunsiker.
Shows emotional insight by reading Will's mood and asking if he is sad.
Nods enthusiastically when offered to see the play center, showing openness and positive engagement.
Approaches the play center and begins to explore the climbing structures, displaying curiosity but no fear or aggression.
Eagerly nods to see the play center and confidently enters the caged atrium area, climbing up ledges and leaping to a bar.
Shows joy and playful energy while climbing and swinging, indicating friendly and good-natured behavior.
Reads Will's eyes and reacts with dread and panic when locked in, showing emotional sensitivity and trust in Will.
Frantically signs and pleads desperately when faced with confinement, demonstrating sincerity and a capacity for emotional connection.
Tries to open the locked gate to escape, showing a strong desire for freedom but no hostility or aggression toward caretakers.
Swings skillfully from bar to bar and climbs the tree confidently.
Fails to anticipate being locked in and panics upon realizing he's trapped.
Whimpers and shrieks in distress when forced apart from Will, showing emotional attachment and vulnerability.
Attempts to follow Dodge, trusting him despite the stressful situation.
Continues to pursue freedom and connection despite Dodge's betrayal and being trapped, indicating resilience but also possible naivety.
Attempts to bend the bars apart and pries them with his teeth to escape the cage.
Follows Dodge through the play area and caged bridge despite stress.
Runs for the cage door expecting freedom but is tricked and trapped in a dead-end cage.
Lets out a primal, blood-curdling scream expressing pain and betrayal.
Sits quietly in a corner with his head down, showing vulnerability and sorrow.
Throws a handful of disgusting food in Dodge's face, leading apes to laugh.
Shoots Dodge the finger after being insulted.
Throws a handful of disgusting food in Dodge's face, provoking laughter among the apes and surprising the humans.
Shoots Dodge the finger defiantly, showing boldness and confidence in a hostile situation.
Allows himself to be hosed down and pinned into a corner without fighting back or escaping.
Is described as smart, off-the-charts intelligent due to genetic therapy.
Bites off a man's finger while protecting Will's father.
Tentatively explores the common area after waking, showing caution and respect for environment.
Notices Buck, the lone gorilla, and registers his absence from the group, showing awareness and concern for others.
Approaches other apes dressed like a human, aware of being subtly different yet chooses to engage.
Rolls the ball to a nearby chimp, initiating friendly interaction.
Notices that his cage door is open and other cages are empty, cautiously explores the common area and assesses his environment before making a move.
Tries the locked gate, pauses and then chooses a different path toward the bridge, showing problem-solving and patience.
Observes the gorilla Buck alone and notes he is not with the others, demonstrating situational awareness.
Carefully enters the atrium, watches how the apes react to him, and gauges their behavior by their silence and stares.
Hesitates briefly whether to approach the tree or return to the cage, showing cautious decision-making rather than impulsiveness.
Initiates social interaction by rolling the ball to a nearby chimp, testing and engaging with others skillfully to gain acceptance.
Jerks his arm away when Rocket pulls at his sleeve, tries to walk around him rather than escalate.
Accidentally slaps Rocket in struggle but tries to block further blows, attempts to keep distance rather than fight back aggressively.
Breaks loose and crawls away, defensive rather than offensive in confrontation.
Considers options when confronted by Rocket, shows hesitation and fear, tries to avoid conflict by attempting to walk around and escape.
Struggles physically during altercation, breaks free despite being overpowered and bitten, attempts to defend himself under pressure.
Jerks arm away when Rocket examines his sleeve, possibly reactive rather than calculated.
Makes a long, low sound and tries to communicate his needs despite language barrier and restraints.
Shows despair and defeat when unable to free himself and make others understand.
Does not resist or lash out at Stewart despite being restrained and in pain.
Attempts to communicate using signs and sounds despite being restrained and injured.
Pulls at restraints but sags with defeat, overcome with despair.
Watches Dodge disrespectfully urinate into chimpanzee's feeding trough and feels disgusted.
Closely observes the opening of his cage lock and the handling of the apes with electric prods, showing awareness and concern for others.
Pays close attention to the lock as it slides open, maneuvering to get a better view of the situation.
Watches Dodge disrespectfully urinate in the chimpanzee feeding trough, showing awareness and disgust.
Is bandaged, beat-up, miserable, and passive as he picks at primate chow.
Shows concern and sympathy for Buck, the isolated gorilla, noticing his misery.
Expresses clear excitement and affection upon seeing Will, indicating trust and friendliness.
Tugs Will away from Dodge, showing a desire for connection and closeness.
After Will promises to get him out but then hesitates, Caesar feels incredulous and outraged, then silently turns away without confrontation.
Does not respond verbally or sign after feeling abandoned, instead quietly walking away, showing restraint rather than hostility.
Communicates clearly with Will using signing; shows controlled excitement and hope about being taken home.
Realizes and processes Will's inability to take him home immediately; shows emotional awareness.
Responds to disappointment by turning away silently and walking back to his cage without confrontation.
Does not verbally insist or negotiate for immediate release when seeing Will might leave him behind.

Makes eye contact with Dodge when Stewart tends to his injury, indicating trust or connection despite Dodge's hostility.
Retrieves scissors and medical tape stealthily and skillfully constructs a tool by weaving tape through sticks, showing planning and manual skill.
Notices Maurice watching him and communicates silently with a finger to lips to maintain secrecy, indicating social intelligence and awareness.
Patiently and persistently fashions a tool to unlock his cage and free himself.
Unlocks the cage of fellow ape Buck and gently tries to wake him without force.
Does not abandon Buck despite the inconvenience; waits and tries to rouse him carefully.
Creates a three-foot long arm contraption with scissors taped to the end to open the cage latch remotely.
Persists after multiple failed attempts to hook the latch, showing problem-solving and patience.
Silently frees himself and a companion (Maurice) from captivity at night, demonstrating tactical thinking and stealth.
Approaches the sleeping gorilla Buck cautiously, understands the risks, and attempts a non-confrontational wake-up.
Hesitates before entering Buck's cage and when Buck reacts angrily, Caesar nervously beckons him towards escape rather than reacting impulsively.
Makes a clear gesture to Buck to follow him, attempting to take initiative and lead.
Stands back and silently watches Buck performing gorilla wind sprints, showing patience and observation skills.
Notices Maurice using sign language and reacts with surprise, indicating awareness of unusual or advanced behavior.
Cautiously warns Maurice about Dodge, recognizing the threat of humans to apes.
Whacks Rocket in the head to assert dominance and then seals dominance with hand gesture
Makes eye contact with each chimpanzee as he walks by after establishing himself as alpha
Brings cookies to Rocket and opens all the cages, freeing the chimps and sharing food.
Leads the other apes to join orangutans and gorillas in a communal setting, creating a unified party atmosphere.

Explains the strength of unity among different ape species by breaking individual twigs and then unbreakable bundles together.
Opens the orangutan and gorilla cages carefully, leading the apes in despite initial discomfort, showing situational awareness and leadership.
Organizes distribution of cookies among diverse ape groups to build unity and strength, demonstrating strategic thinking.

Focuses his attention thoughtfully on Cornelia, indicating social awareness and calm observation.
Allows Rocket to regain a place in the group though not as Alpha, showing confidence and ability to manage social hierarchy effectively.
Takes care to quietly escape the cage to find his mother, showing determination and concern.
Hesitates when Rocket wants to come with him, indicating he considers the feelings and desires of others.
Gently takes Rocket's face in his hands and looks into his eyes, showing tenderness and care.
Opens Rocket's cage to free him despite the unknown consequences, demonstrating trust and loyalty.
Uses his contraption to escape from the orangutan cage.
Calmly examines Rocket's changed eyes and recalls the bite wound's significance.
hesitates when Rocket calls out, showing caution before taking action.
Decides to open Rocket's cage to let him out, showing decisiveness and trust.
Heads carefully across the ranch and onto the road, moving stealthily.
Noiselessly watches over Will and Stewart as they sleep, face unreadable.
Carefully explores the primate house, checking on the sleeping chimps, showing concern for their wellbeing.
Does not engage with Koba or react negatively despite Koba’s steely, sizing him up; moves on instead.

Carefully surveys the sleeping chimps in the dark, peering into each cage to locate someone specific.
Moves on after sizing up Koba without revealing his intentions or engaging, maintaining focus on his goal.
Looks for familiar faces among the caged chimps, shows disappointment when no connection is found.
Turns away from a sick young chimp, appearing crestfallen.
Yells for Rocket and escapes with him to avoid danger.
Removes his human clothing upon return, possibly indicating acceptance of his identity.
Carefully approaches Cornelia's cage without waking others, showing consideration and gentleness.
Observes the sleeping chimps around him, showing a protective awareness of their state.
Freeing Rocket from the cage, then collapsing exhausted, indicating care and self-sacrifice.
Opens Rocket's cage and immediately collapses, showing physical and mental exhaustion.

Emerges into the common area early morning when chimps are asleep, showing patience and timing.
Freezes when Dodge enters with a shovel, demonstrating situational awareness and caution.
Does not immediately act aggressively or recklessly on Dodge's presence; remains calm and controlled.
Stands tall and refuses to obey Dodge's aggressive orders to get into the cage, showing defiance against oppression.
Speaks a firm 'No' to Dodge after a buildup of tension and threat, surprising others and asserting himself.
Does not retaliate with unnecessary violence despite Dodge's aggression, instead shows controlled resistance.
Leads and controls other apes, ensuring their protection when freed.
Allows or permits the violent treatment of humans, with apes battering people and holding them captive.
Is clearly the alpha male, in control and surrounded by his closest followers despite captivity.
Refuses to let apes return to cages, insists apes do not belong confined, stands firm on his conviction.
Does not use violence immediately but shows defiance and distrust toward humans.
Refuses to obey demands to make the apes return to cages, clearly communicates his stance with confidence and clarity.
Appears calm and resolute in tense, dangerous situation with humans and other apes around.
Refuses to take poisoned cookie and insists 'Never again', showing restraint and a moral boundary against killing.
Slaps the poisoned cookie from Will's hand to prevent harm, showing protective behavior and rejection of violence.
Does not deny killing a man initially, creating ambiguity; then insists he did not kill, showing possible confusion or reluctance to be vulnerable.
Turns away and walks off, indicating emotional withdrawal and unwillingness to engage with Will despite the tension.
Refuses to take the poisoned cookie despite pressure, shows strong will and self-control.
Slaps the cookie from Will's hand decisively, demonstrating clear communication and boundary-setting.
Does not deny accusations and shows bewilderment when confronted with consequences, displaying emotional complexity but some uncertainty.
Chooses not to fight despite Rocket's support, indicating restraint and confidence in handling the situation.
His denial of killing the man contradicts Will's knowledge, possibly suggesting evasiveness or a gap in honesty/transparency.
Leads apes out of captivity with a fierce, determined call for no more cages, inspiring unity and hope among apes.
Does not wait for Will's call, acts decisively without hesitation, showing a focus on leadership over interpersonal reassurance.
Climbs atop the truck tailgate and commands the apes to rise, using loud clear vocal signals and physical gestures like pounding his chest to assert leadership.
Immediately leads the apes off the ranch in an organized group, demonstrating effective leadership and tactical movement.
Does not wait for Will's call but acts decisively, showing confidence and decisiveness in a critical moment.
Leads a coordinated and timely liberation of lab chimps by breaking into the lab and opening cages without hesitation.
Walks through the lab with Buck, eyeing the destruction caused by the apes.
Doubles back from leading apes to scoop up the little girl and put her out of harm's way.
Doubles back from the lead to scoop up the little girl and put her down out of harm's way.
Continue herding the apes forward with clear direction, showing he knows where he’s going.
Scoops a vulnerable individual up and puts her down out of harm's way before continuing to herd the apes.
Puts a vulnerable individual down out of harm's way, then continues herding the apes forward with a clear sense of direction, showing spatial awareness and leadership.
Leads the apes through a chaotic environment, dodging people and jumping over obstacles skillfully, demonstrating situational awareness and physical capability.
Approaches the zoo where animals and humans are panicking, maintaining control over his group amidst confusion, indicating calmness and command under pressure.
Slows down and stays alongside Cornelia when she falters, showing concern for her wellbeing.
Leads the apes in coordinating a successful breakout from the zoo, demonstrating strategic planning and command.
Makes eye contact with a grizzled chimpanzee to signal the coordinated escape, showing effective communication and leadership.
Slows down to help Cornelia who looks ill, showing empathy but also managing to maintain leadership during crisis.

Attempts to carry Cornelia across the bridge despite the dangerous situation but then allows Maurice to take over when the risk increases.
Divides his army strategically and leads them to safety by signaling and commanding others to climb and move cautiously, showing care for the group's survival.
Barks orders sharply at Maurice and Buck, treating them as mere tools rather than comrades.

Recognizes the tactical situation at the end of the bridge and signals to Maurice to take apes below the railing while commanding Buck and others to take strategic positions, then leads by climbing the cables into the fog, coordinating a multi-pronged approach.
Demonstrates confidence and decisiveness by barking clear commands and personally leading the climb despite the danger.
Does not hesitate or freeze when sharpshooters open fire and an ape falls to his death; continues to push forward with the plan.
Climbs cables under fire, perseveres despite injury.
Makes eye contact with Rocket as Rocket falls to his death.
Climbs up the ascending cables of the bridge under heavy fire, showing physical skill and courage.
Despite being shot and stumbling, he maintains grip until Rocket rescues him, indicating resilience and presence of mind.
Relying on Rocket to save him from falling after being shot, showing some dependence on others for survival in a critical moment.
Leads the apes effectively during the battle, inspiring a victorious charge.
Makes eye contact with Rocket before he falls, showing situational awareness and emotional connection.
